title: Frank Lampard drops Christian Pulisic playing time hint after Chelsea hat-trick
text:

Chelsea boss Frank Lampard has revealed why Turf Moor hat-trick hero Christian Pulisic has not had more playing time.

Pulisic's treble helped fire Chelsea to a 4-2 victory over Burnley on Saturday as Lampard's fourth-placed side stayed went level on points with Leicester and stayed in touch with Liverpool and Manchester City .

USA midfielder Pulisic has struggled for minutes since his £58million move from Borussia Dortmund, with Saturday's game just a fourth Premier League start for the 21-year-old.

However, his impact is clearly increasing as he became the youngest Chelsea player to score a hat-trick after playing a starring role against Ajax on Wednesday night, setting up Michy Batshuayi's winner in the Champions League clash.

Lampard said Pulisic joined up with the Chelsea squad this summer eager to be thrust into action.

(Image: PA)

But the manager insisted he has had to be cautious with Pulisic after the playmaker had just a week's rest this summer due to USA's run to the final of the Gold Cup.

"He had a week's break this summer," said Lampard following the win over Burnley. "He arrived for a big price and wanted to come straight back in but at the same time why am I going to throw him in?

"So I have to do it in the right way and get the best out of him. I'm delighted for him."

With Chelsea having won six times and lost just once since their opening day humbling by Manchester United , Lampard has a squad in form and has not had to depend on a player who needed to build up his match fitness.

(Image: Action Images via Reuters)

And after his assist against Ajax in midweek, Pulisic earned praise from the manager for his attitude and application.

"Sometimes the toughest part of management is leaving out players that really want to play week-in, week-out. You rely on them being positive and coming on to make an impact," Lampard said after the clash in Amsterdam.

"You have to give Christian huge credit because he looked so lively and the assist is just as important as the finish."
description: £58m star has struggled for game time - but manager insists he's introducing him to Premier League 'the right way'
